DataElement.preferredName: Newly Diagnosed Disease or Disorder No Treatment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to a newly diagnosed disease or disorder and has had no treatment as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Newly Diagnosed Disease or Disorder No Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Very recently determined. Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The non-affirmative response to a question._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Very recently determined.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: No Therapeutic Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has a newly diagno
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a newly diagnosed solid tumor, lymphoma or multiple myeloma malignancy, are they treatment na√Øve for this malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed and pathologically confirmed, previously untreated AML as defined by World Health Organization (WHO) criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex -1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed, untreated AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed and previously untreated AML (except APL) (greater than or equal to 20% blasts in bone marrow or extramedullary leukemia) according to the World Health Organization (WHO), 2016 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a newly diagnosed primary and/or metastatic solid tumor or hematologic malignancy, are they treatment naive for this malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have newly diagnosed (dx) MM as defined by standard International Myeloma working group (IMWG)?
